definitions.definition: a part of the sea, or of a large lake, partly surrounded by a wide curve of the land

examples.text: a magnificent view across the bay

definitions.definition: a marked section of ground either inside or outside a building, for example for a vehicle to park in, for storing things, etc.

examples.text: Put the equipment in No 3 bay.

definitions.definition: a curved area of a room or building that sticks out from the rest of the building
a horse of a dark brown colour

examples.text: He was riding a big bay.

definitions.definition: a deep noise, especially the noise made by dogs when hunting
a small tree with dark green leaves with a sweet smell that are used in cooking
the leaves of the bay tree, used in cooking as a herb
when an animal that is being hunted is at bay, it must turn and face the dogs and hunters because it is impossible to escape from them
to prevent an enemy from coming close or a problem from having a bad effect

examples.text: I'm trying to keep my creditors at bay.
Charlotte bit her lip to hold the tears at bay.

wordOrigin: noun sense 1 late Middle English: from Old French baie, from Old Spanish bahia, of unknown origin. noun senses 2 to 3 late Middle English: from Old French baie, from baer ‘to gape’, from medieval Latin batare, of unknown origin. noun sense 4 Middle English: from Old French bai, from Latin badius.
